cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of the intended buffer. This can lead to crashes, information disclosure, or other undefined behavior.
explanation: The function accesses 'args[idx]' without performing any bounds checking on the 'idx' parameter. If 'idx' is controlled by an attacker or derived from untrusted input without proper validation, it could lead to an out-of-bounds read, potentially causing a crash (denial of service) or information disclosure from adjacent memory locations.

If 'idx' is controlled by an attacker or derived from untrusted input without proper validation, it could lead to an out-of-bounds read, potentially causing a crash (denial of service) or information disclosure from adjacent memory locations.

cwe_description: The software reads data past the end, or before the beginning, of an intended buffer.
explanation: The function check_for_opt_buffer_arg accesses args[idx] without performing any bounds checking on the idx parameter. If idx is controlled by an attacker or an untrusted source and falls outside the valid range of the args array, it will result in an out-of-bounds read. This can lead to a crash (denial of service) or potentially information disclosure. The vulnerability lies in the lack of validation of idx before dereferencing args[idx].
